00020 #define                 NUM_SEC_IN_DAY                                  86400
00021 #define                 NUM_SEC_IN_HOUR                                 3600
00022 #define                 NUM_SEC_IN_MIN                                  60                            
00023 #define                 ROUNDTO_MIN                                           5
00024 
00025 #define                 NUM_MIN_IN_DAY                                  1440
00026 #define                 NUM_MIN_IN_HOUR                                 60
00027 
00028 //Kris:
00029 //This is the plan for game time...
00030 //Game time should be restricted to outside code.  Think of it as encapsulation.  Anyway, using these
00031 //simple functions, you will be able to change the amount of time that passes per frame.  The gameloop will
00032 //automatically update the clock once per cycle, regardless of the mode you are in.
00033 //This does pose potential problems in modes such as the editor, or similar where time shouldn't pass, and
00034 //isn't currently handled.  The best thing to do in these cases is call the PauseGame() function when entering
00035 //such a mode, and UnPauseGame() when finished.  Everything will be restored just the way you left it.  This
00036 //is much simpler to handle in the overall scheme of things.  
00037 
00038 //PAUSE FEATURES
00039 //Pauses and unpauses the game.  It sets and clears a flag which preserves the time rate.
00040 extern void PauseGame();
00041 extern void UnPauseGame();
00042 extern void TogglePause();
00043 extern BOOLEAN GamePaused();
00044 extern void LockPauseState( UINT32 uiUniqueReasonId );
00045 extern void UnLockPauseState();
00046 extern BOOLEAN PauseStateLocked();
00047 
00048 //USING HIGH RESOLUTION TIME RATE MANIPULATION/ACCESS
00049 //Allows external code to change the time rate.
00050 void SetGameHoursPerSecond( UINT32 uiGameHoursPerSecond );
00051 void SetGameMinutesPerSecond( UINT32 uiGameMinutesPerSecond );
00052 void SetGameSecondsPerSecond( UINT32 uiGameSecondsPerSecond );
00053 //Allows access to the current time rate.
00054 UINT32 GetGameSecondsPerFrame();
00055 void RenderPausedGameBox( void );
00056 
00057 
00058 void StopTimeCompression( void );
00059 void StartTimeCompression( void );
00060 BOOLEAN IsTimeBeingCompressed( void );    // returns FALSE if time isn't currently being compressed for ANY reason (various pauses, etc.)
00061 BOOLEAN IsTimeCompressionOn( void );            // returns TRUE if the player currently wants time to be compressing
00062 
00063 //USING TIME COMPRESSION
00064 //Allows the setting/changing/access of time rate via predefined compression values.
00065 //These functions change the index in giTimeCompressSpeeds which aren't in any
00066 //particular mathematical pattern.  The higher the index, the faster the time is processed
00067 //per frame.  These functions have their limits, so game time will also be between 
00068 //TIME_COMPRESS_X1 to TIME_COMPRESS_X8 based in the laptop time compression.
00069 void SetGameTimeCompressionLevel( UINT32 uiCompressionRate );
00070 void DecreaseGameTimeCompressionRate();
00071 void IncreaseGameTimeCompressionRate();
00072 
00073 //USING CLOCK RESOLUTION
00074 //Note, that changing the clock resolution doesn't effect the amount of game time that passes per
00075 //real second, but how many times per second the clock is updated.  This rate will break up the actual
00076 //time slices per second into smaller chunks.  This is useful for animating strategic movement under
00077 //fast time compression, so objects don't warp around.
00078 void SetClockResolutionToDefault();  //1 time per second
00079 //Valid range is 1 - 60 times per second.
00080 void SetClockResolutionPerSecond( UINT8 ubNumTimesPerSecond );
00081 //Function for accessing the current rate
00082 UINT8 ClockResolution();
00083 
00084 //time compression defines
00085 enum
00086 {
00087       NOT_USING_TIME_COMPRESSION = -1,
00088       TIME_COMPRESS_X0,
00089       TIME_COMPRESS_X1,
00090       TIME_COMPRESS_5MINS,
00091       TIME_COMPRESS_30MINS,
00092       TIME_COMPRESS_60MINS,
00093       TIME_SUPER_COMPRESS,
00094       NUM_TIME_COMPRESS_SPEEDS
00095 };
00096 
00097 
00098 //dereferenced with the above enumerations to provide the actual time compression rate.
00099 extern INT32 giTimeCompressSpeeds[ NUM_TIME_COMPRESS_SPEEDS ];

00135 //Advanced function used by certain event callbacks.  In the case where time is warped, certain event

00140 //This value represents the time that the sector was loaded.  If you are in sector A9, and leave
00141 //the game clock at that moment will get saved into the temp file associated with it.  The next time you
00142 //enter A9, this value will contain that time.  Used for scheduling purposes.
00143 extern UINT32                       guiTimeCurrentSectorWasLastLoaded;

00176 //IMPORTANT FUNCTION:  Used whenever an event or situation is deemed important enough to cancel the
00177 //further processing of time in this current time slice!  This can only be used inside of event callback
00178 //functions -- otherwise, it'll be ignored and automatically reset.  An example of this would be when arriving
00179 //in a new sector and being prompted to attack or retreat.

00181 void PauseTimeForInterupt();
